RBE 1001

Freshmen Year College

The prequel to the four course series of Robotics Engineernig this courses teaches the basics for robotics and sets the standard for what to expect next in Robotics. Topics covered include sensor performance and integration, electric and pneumatic actuators, power transmission, materials and static force analysis, controls and programmable embedded computer systems, system integration, and robotic applications. Laboratory sessions consist of hands-on exercises and team projects where students design and build mobile robots.

The final challenge for my year consisted of making a robot capable of picking up ping-pong, tennis and a basket ball. These balls then needed to be raised to heights of 6 inch, 12 inch, 18 inch high towers. Scoring the balls in the towers would give points and based on the number of points the final grade for the robot was calculated. Ping - Pong Balls were worth 1 point, Tennis Balls were worth 2 points, and the Basket Ball was worth 5 points.

Lokesh Gangaramaney @ 2019
